intro: Ononis natrix subvar. media, commonly known as the common whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. This plant is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides, fields, and waste areas.
